paragraphs.name: 6c7d
paragraphs.text: As a result, Apple’s Mac OS third party software ecosystem thrived. Apple’s intense focus on design, in its computers and in its user interfaces, helped its creative users realize what a interactions with a computer and software could be. There was a lot of tinkering, but beyond that:

paragraphs.name: 09f9
paragraphs.text: iPhone marked a huge revolution in software: no such shift in the quality of software since has ever happened again. Almost overnight, we went from rudimentary fragments of a utility to mind-blowing experiments on a tiny computer that went with us everywhere. And apps were gorgeous. A huge, creative base was unleashed on an entirely new medium all at once.

paragraphs.name: c117
paragraphs.text: I went and bought the Surface Studio. It made me incredibly happy, yet profoundly sad that it wasn’t Apple making it.

paragraphs.text: Awesome piece (and Hey!). My one nitpick is that it hasn’t been 4 years. Mac Pro trashcan was previewed in July 2013, specs officially announced Oct 2013 and went on sale December 19th 2013. I remember because that’s my birthday. So it’s been 3 years and change.
